channel.title: How Do I Spawn Items On Client.. (bignoob)
channel.description: Ok Im Completly New To This I Played Rs2 But Thats It till i found this..(pal reccomended) basically just downloaded client and signed in and was reading through about spawning would really like to know how.... i found item lists and clocked about the number being the id thingy but what do i type for say gold.. ps all my levels were 99 when i logged in can i change them and start standard? THANKS IN ADVANCE :) Druss

item.title: How Do I Spawn Items On Client.. (bignoob)
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Why go for efficiency? As long as it’s done, and working, go back to it later

Read full topic

item.title: How Do I Spawn Items On Client.. (bignoob)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:13, topic:275186”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=363551.msg2761246#msg2761246 date=1240534208]
Oops, for the ‘all 99’s’, it’s in the player class, not the client class. Sorry.
[/quote]

You’ll never know… Some people like me would just put maxStats(); in the login method =D[/quote]
That wouldn’t be too efficient.

some might have

depends on your pickup command

item.title: How Do I Spawn Items On Client.. (bignoob)
item.dc:creator: @my_stoof my stoof
item.description:
@my_stoof wrote:

if you dont want to start all 99’s, then go into player.java or client.java depending on your source. If you see something like public int addSkillxp = 1, 13500000 something like that
the 1 in that line is the skills id number and 13500000 is the experience

[quote=“Drussy, post:3, topic:275186”][quote author=o.O O.o link=topic=363551.msg2761019#msg2761019 date=1240529114]
One step at a time. ::pickup int int
Example: ::pickup 0995 100000
Or, ::pickup 00995 100000
The other stuff… Wait till you’re a little more experienced.
[/quote] Ok man thanks alot ill try that now… but err it kinda sucks ya have to start 99 everything is there no easy way?
yer thanks again o.0 0.o apprieciate the help :)[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I Spawn Items On Client.. (bignoob)

yer thanks again o.0 0.o apprieciate the help

Edit your initialize() method.[/quote] Sorry Man Dont Understand… Do Ya Mean the (bignoob) Bit?
